thread.section_title: WSJ Life, Style & Arts: Weekend News and Reads
thread.title: ‘Peter Rabbit’ Review: All Hopped Up

author: Joe Morgenstern
title: ‘Peter Rabbit’ Review: All Hopped Up
text: Instead of being beloved, a feature version of “Peter Rabbit” from Sony Pictures Animation may well become beliked, but Beatrix Potter will still be turning over in her vegetable garden. Peter, voiced by James Corden, has lost his innocence in this frantic, fitfully funny hybrid of animation and live action. So, to be sure, has the film’s young audience; gone are the days when most kids first encountered the classic characters of children’s literature in the turnable pages of holdable books. Yet movies can give such characters new dimensions, while this one settles for a too-hip tone and all-out war—sticks of dynamite...
